title: U.S. to block all flights to Cuba outside Havana
text:
Background: The U.S. prohibited some educational, cultural and recreational tours to Cuba starting in June and said it would deny requests for private and corporate planes and boats to the country, citing Cuba's "destabilizing role" in the Western hemisphere.

The bottom line: American Airlines, JetBlue and Delta have 45 days to review the U.S. decision and cease operations in Cuban cities other than Havana, the Miami Herald reports. The majority of U.S. flights to Cuba run through Havana, AP notes.

Go deeper: Trump administration to enforce new Cuban travel restrictions
description: The U.S. aims to prevent tourism to Cuba, restricting the island's income.
